titleStmt.title: Tables of the emperour kings, and all the soveraign princes and electoral that are now alive in Europe. 1. Their names. 2. When they were born. 3. When they came to their respective crowns and principalities. 4. When and whom they have married. 5. What children they have got, and the time of their birth. Together with their natural children, owned by them. Very useful to all that read the London, Harlem, Amsterdam and Paris Gazette.

titleStmt.title: Tables of the emperour kings, and all the soveraign princes and electoral that are now alive in Europe. 1. Their names. 2. When they were born. 3. When they came to their respective crowns and principalities. 4. When and whom they have married. 5. What children they have got, and the time of their birth. Together with their natural children, owned by them. Very useful to all that read the London, Harlem, Amsterdam and Paris Gazette.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Abel Roper, at the Mitre, and Rich. Southby, at the Golden Fleece, in Fleet-street,

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

keywords.term: Europe -- Kings and rulers -- Early works to 1800.

div.p: Imprimatur,

div.head: TABLES OF THE Emperour, Kings And all the SOVERAIGN PRINCES AND ELECTORAL
div.p: That are now alive in Europe.
1. Their Names.
2. When they were Born.
3. When they came to their re≈øpective Crowns and Principalities.
4. When and whom they have Married.
5. What Children they have got, and the time of their Birth.
Together with their natural Children, owned by them.
Very u≈øeful to all that read the London, Harlem, Amsterdam and Pa ‚Ä¢ is Gaz ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ te.

London, Printed for Abel „Äà‚Ä¶„Äâ Mitre, and Rich. Southby at „Äà‚Ä¶„Äâ
Fleece, in Fleet-≈øtreet, 1 ‚Ä¢ 93.

div.head: TO THE READER.
div.p:
THE Collection of the following Tables, I fir≈øt made for my own ∆≤≈øe, but being importuned by ≈øome
Friends of mine to oblige them with a Copy, and the tran≈øcribing of them being very trouble≈øom, I at la≈øt re≈øolved to Print them, in order to content my Friends, and to oblige the publick.

The Tables are exact to a day, and tho' many will wonder how a particular Man
could come to the knowledge of it, yet tho≈øe that are ver≈øed in Genealogy will ea≈øily know from whence they are taken.

div.head: ¬ß. I. The German Line. The Emperour of the Germans.
div.p: LEOPOLD Emperour of the Germans, born June the 9th 1640.
He was proclaimed King of Hungary, 1655.
King of Bohemia, 1656.
And cho≈øen Emperour, 1658.
Eleonora, Empre≈øs of the Germans, elde≈øt daughter to Philip William Duke of Neuburg, and Elect. Pal. born Jan. 6. 1655.
Married to the Emperour, Decem. 14. 1676.
Their Children.
1. Jo≈øeph King of the Romans, born July the 16. 1678.
He was Crowned King of Hungary, 1688.
And cho≈øen King of the Romans, 1689.
2. Mary Elizabeth, born Dec. the 13. 1680.
3. Leopold, born 1682, died Aug. the 4. 1684.
4. Mary Anne, born Sept. the 7. 1683.
5. Mary There≈øa, born Aug. the 22. 1684.
6. Charles, born Octob. the fir≈øt, 1685.
7. Mary Jo≈øepha, born March the 6. 1687.
8. Anne Jo≈øepha, born March the 26. 1689.
The Emperour has but one Si≈øter alive.
Eleonora, the Queen Dutche≈øs, born May the 21. 1653.
Married to Michael King of Poland, 1670.
And after his Death, to Charles Duke of Lorrain, 1678.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The Emperour has been twice Married before.
1. With Margaretha There≈øa, Daughter to Philip the IV. King of Spain; who died March the 20. 1673.
2. With Claudia Felia, Daughter to Arch Duke of Ferdinand, who died April the 8. 1676.
By the fir≈øt Wife he had Four Children.
1. Ferdinand, born Sep. the 28. 1667.
Died Jan. the 13. 1668.
2. Mary Antonia, born Jan. the 18. 1669.
Married to the pre≈øent Elector of Bavaria, 1688.
3. John, born and died 1670.
4. Mariana, born and died, 1672.
With his ≈øecond Wife he had but two.
1. Anne, born and died, 1674.
2. Mary, born 1675, died, 1676.

div.head: ¬ß. II. The Spani≈øh, or Caroline Line.
Spain.
div.p: CHarles II. King of Spain, born Nov. the 6. 1661.
He Succeeded his Father, 1665.
Mary Queen of Spain, Daughter to Philip William Duke of Neuburg, and Elect. Pal. born Octob. the 28. 1667.
Married to the King, Aug. the 28. 1689.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The pre≈øent King of Spain, had in a former Marriage to his Wife, Mary Loui≈øa, daughter to the pre≈øent Duke of Orleans, born March the 27, 1662.
Married Nov. the 17. 1679.
Died, 1689.

div.head: England.
The Hou≈øes of Na≈ø≈øau, and Stuard.
¬ß I.
div.p: WIlliam III. King of Great Brittain, born nine days after his Fathers death, Nov. 14. 1650.
He was re≈øtored to his hereditary dignity in the united Provinces, 1672.
Proclaimed King of England, France and Ireland, Feb. the 14 1689.
Crowned April‚ñ™ the 11. 1689.
Proclaimed King of Scotland, April the 11. 1689.
Mary Queen of Great Britain, born April the 30. 1662.
Married to his Maje≈øty, the then Prince of Orange, Nov. the 4. 1677.
Proclaimed Queen of England, France and Ireland, Feb. 14. 1689.
Crowned, Apr. 11, 1689.
Proclaime≈øt Queen of Scotland, Apr. the 11, 1689.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: GEorge, Prince of Denmark, born 1651.
Anne, only Si≈øter to her Maje≈øty, born 1664. in Febr.
Married to the Prince, July the 28. 1683.
Their Children,
William Duke of Gloce≈øter, born July, 1689.
Their Royal Highne≈ø≈øes had be≈øides three Children more, viz. The Lady Mary, the Lady Anne, and another Prince≈øs who died in their Infancy, 1688.

div.head: ¬ß. III.
div.p: THe Prince≈øs and Prince≈ø≈øes, of the Royal Blood of England, that are not excluded from the Succe≈ø≈øion of the Crown, by the late Act of Parliament.
Sophia, Dutche≈øs of Hanover, daughter to Frederic the V. Elect. Pal. and King of Bohemia, born Octob. the 13. 1630.
Married to the Duke, 1658.
Her Children.
I. George Lewis, born May the 28, 1660.
He Married Sophie Dorothe, daughter to the Duke of Zell, by whom he has 2 Princes.
1. George Augu≈øt, born Octob. the 30, 1683.
2. William Erne≈øt, born, 1685.
II. Chri≈øtian, born Sep. the 29, 1671.
III. Erne≈øt Augu≈øt, born Sep. the 17, 1674.
IV. Sophia Charlotta, born Oct. the 20, 1668.
Married to the pre≈øent Elect of Brandenburg: She has bore him two Princes, of which there is but one alive.
Frederic William, born Aug. the 4, 1688.

div.head: ¬ß. IV.
div.p: THe other Princes, and Prince≈ø≈øes that are Roman Catholicks,
I. Anne Mary, the pre≈øent Dutche≈øs of Savoy, born Augu≈øt the 27th 1669.
Her Children,
1. Mary Adetherd, born Dec. the 6, 1685.
2. Another Prince≈øs, born Aug. the 30, 1688.
II. Charlotta Elizabeth, the pre≈øent Dutche≈øs of Orleans, her Children.
1. Philip Duke of Chartres.
2. Elizabeth of Chartres.
III. Anne, the pre≈øent Prince≈øs of Conde, daughter to Edward Count Palatin, and Grand-Child to the King of Bohemia; her Children.
1. Mary of Bourbon.
2. Lewis Duke of Anguien.
3. Mary of Monmorancy.
4. Anne Mary of Anguien.
5. Aloi≈øa of Conde.
IV. Two daughters of Benedicta Henrietta Philippina, Dutche≈øs of Hanover, daughter to Edward Count Palatin, and Grand-Child to the King of Bohemia.
1. Charlotta Felicitas, born March the 8, 1671.
2. Withelmina Amalia, born April the 26, 1673.
The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Na≈ø≈øau, are to be found among the Princes of the Empire.

div.head: ¬ß. I.
div.p: LEwis the XIV. the French King, born Sept. the 5th, 1638.
He Succeeded his Father, 1642.
Was Crowned, 1654.
He Married Mary There≈øa, daughter to Philip the IV. King of Spain, 1660, who died 1683.
Lewis the Dauphin, born Nov the fir≈øt, 1661.
He Married Anne daughter to Ferdinand, Elect of Bavaria, Mareh the 7th, 1680, who died, 1690.
His Children.

1. Lewis Duke of
Burgundy, born Aug. the 6th, 1682.
2. Philip Duke of Anjou, born Nov. the 19th, 1683.
3. Ga≈øton Duke of Berry, born Augu≈øt the 31, 1686.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The French King's natural Children are,
I. Born of Madam de la Valiere, Dutche≈øs of Vaujour.
1. Mary Anne, of Bourbon, born, 1666.
Married to the Prince of Conti, 1680.
2. Lewis of Bourbon, Duke of Vermandois, born, 1667.
Died, 1683.
II. Born of Madam de Monte≈øpan.
1. Lewis Augu≈øt, of Bourbon, Duke of Maine, born, 1670.
Legitimated, 1673.
2. Lewis Cae≈øar, of Bourbon, Count of Vexin, born, 1672.
Died, 1683.
3. Aloi≈øa, of Nantes, born, 1673.
Married to the Duke of Bourbon, 1685.
4. Aloi≈øa Mary, died 1681.
5. Lewis Alexander, of Bourbon, Count of Toulouze, born 1678.
Legitimated, 1681.
6. Franci≈øca Mary, of Blois, born 1681.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: PHilip, Duke of Orleans, only Brother to the French King, born Sep the 21, 1640.
Charlotte Elizabeth, Dutche≈øs of Orleans, daughter to Charles Lewis Elector Palatin, born 1652.
Married to the Duke 1671.
Their Children,

1. Philip Duke of
Chartres, born Aug. the 2, 1674.
2. Elizabeth, of Chartres, born Sep. the 13th, 1676.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The Duke of Orleans, had in a former Marriage with Henrietta, daughter to Charles the I. King of Great Brittain, (who died 1670.) four Children.
1. Mary Aloi≈øa, born March the 27th, 1662.

Married to Charles II.
King of Spain, Nov. the 17th, 1679, died, 1689.
2. Philip, died in his Infancy.
3. Anonima.
4. Anne Mary, born Aug. the 27th, 1669.
Married to Victor Amade, the pre≈øent Duke of Savoy, 1684.

div.head: ¬ß. III.
div.p: THe Princes of the Blood.

I. Henry, of Bourbon, Prince of Conde, born
July the 29th, 1643.
Anne, Prince≈øs of Conde, daughter to Edward Count Palatin of the Rhine, born July the 23, 1647.
Married to the Prince Dec. the 11th, 1663.
Their Children,
1. Mary There≈øa, of Bourbon, born, 1666.
2. Lewis, of Bourbon, Duke of Anguien, born, 1668.

He Married Aloi≈øa, of
Nantes, the French Kings natural daughter, 1685.
3. Mary Anne, of Monmorency, born, 1675.
4. Anne Mary, of Anguien, born, 1676.
5. Aloi≈øa, of Conde, born, 1678.
II. Francis Lewis, of Bourbon, Prince of Conti, born, 1664.

div.head: ¬ß I.
div.p: CHri≈øtian V. King of Denmark, born, 1645.
He Succeeded his Father, Feb. the 9th, 1670.
Charlotta Amalia, Queen of Denmark, daughter to William VI. Landgrave, of He≈øs, born April the 27th, 1650.
Married to the King, 1668.
Their Children,
1. Frederic, call'd the Crown-Prince, born Octob. the 21, 1671.
2. Chri≈øtian, born Oct. the 18th, 1675.
3. Sophia, Hedwig, born Augu≈øt the 28th, 1677.
4. Chri≈øtina Charlotta, born January the 18th, 1677.
5. Charles, born Octo. the 25th, 1680.
6. William, born, 1687.
Prince George, the Kings only Brother,

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The King of Denmark. has one natural Brother, Frederic, Count Guldenlow, Vice-Roy of Norway.
And by the Counte≈øs of Sam≈øee, he has ≈øeveral natural Children.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: THe Chief Princes of the ≈øeveral Branches of the Royal Hou≈øe of Denmark,
I. Chri≈øtian Albret, Duke of Gottorp, born Feb. the 3, 1641.
Frederica Amalia, Dutche≈øs of Gottorp, the Kings Si≈øter, born, 1648.
Married to the Duke, 1667.
Their Children,
1. Sophia Amalia, born 1670.
2. Frederic, born, 1671.
3. Chri≈øtian Augu≈øt, born, 1673.
4. Mary Elizabeth, born, 1678.
II. Chri≈øtian Adolph, Duke of Sunderburg, born, 1641.
There are of this Branch, be≈øides Eighteen Princes alive.
III. Chri≈øtian Augu≈øt, Duke of Nordburg, born, 1689.
IV. Chri≈øtian, Duke of Glucksburg, born, 1627.
He has three Sons,
1. Philip Erne≈øt, born, 1673.
2. Joachim Adolph, born, 1679.
3. Chri≈øtian Augu≈øt, born, 1681.
V. John Adolf, Duke of Ploen, born, 1634.
Dorothea Sophia, Dutche≈øs of Ploen, daughter to Rudolf Augu≈øt, Duke of Walfembuttel, born Jan. the 18th, 1653.
Married to the Duke 1673.
Their Children,
1. Adolf Augu≈øt, born, 1680.
2. Joachim Erne≈øt, born, 1681.
Died, 1682.
3. John ∆≤lric, born, 1684.
The Duke of Ploen, has one Brother, Joachim Erne≈øt, General of the Spani≈øh Hor≈øe in the Netherlands, born, 1637.

div.head: Sueden.
div.p:
The pre≈øent King of Sueden, is of the Branch
of Deuxponts, of the Hou≈øe Palatin.
Charles IX. King of Sueden, born, 1655.
He Succeeded his Father, 1660.
Ulrica Eleonora, Queen of Sueden, Si≈øter to the pre≈øent King of Denmark, born, 1656.
Married to the King, May the 16th, 1680.
Their Children.
1. Hedewig Sophia, born June the 26th, 1681.
2. Charles, the hereditary Prince, born June the 17th, 1682.
3. Ulrica Eleonora, born Jan. the 21, 1688.
The Princes, Gu≈øtave, Ulric, and Charles Gu≈øtave, died in their Infancy.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The pre≈øent King of Sueden, has one natural Brother, Count Gu≈øtave Carl≈øon.

div.head: Poland.
div.p: The pre≈øent King of Poland, is of the Family of Sobiesky.
John III. King of Poland, was Elected King of Poland, 1673.
The Queen of Poland, daughter to the Marquis d' Arqnin.
Their Children,
1. James,
He Married Hedwig Elizabeth, daughter to Philip William, Duke of Neuburg, and Elector Palatin, 1691.
2. Alexander.
3. Johannes.
4. Ca≈øimir.
5. Leopold.

div.head: ¬ß. I.
div.p: DOn Pedro, King of Portugal, born, 16 ‚Ä¢ 8.
He was Elected Prince Regent, 1668.
He Succeeded his Brother Alfon≈øo, 1683.

Mary Sophia, Queen of Portugal, daughter to Philip William, Duke of
Neuburg, and Elector Palatin, born Aug. the 6th, 1666.
Married to the King, 1687.
Their Children,
1. Don N. born Aug. the 30th, 1688.
2. The Prince of Bre≈øil, born in Octob. 1689.

div.head: Remark,
div.p:
Dan Pedro, in a former Marriage with Mary Franci≈øca, daughter to Charles Amade of Savoy,
Duke of Nemours, his Brother's Wife, had one daughter, Mary Elizabeth, born, 1669.
Died, 1690.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: THe pre≈øent King of Portugal has but one Si≈øter alive, Catherine the Queen Dowager, born Nov. the 14, 1638.
Married to King Charles the II. 1662.

div.head: The VIII. Electors of the German Empire.
(1.) The Eccle≈øia≈øtical.
div.p: I. The Archbi≈øhop and Elector of Mentz.
II. The Archbi≈øhop and Elector of Cologne.
Prince Clement of Bavaria, born Decem. the 5th, 1671.

He was Elected Archbi≈øhop and Elector of
Cologne, July the 14th, 1688.
He is be≈øides Bi≈øhop of Ratisbonne and Frei≈øing.
III. The Archbi≈øhop and Elector of Frevire.

div.head: (2.) The Secular.
div.p: IV. The Elector and King of Bohemia.
V. The Elector of Bavaria, Maximilian Mary, born June the 11th, 1662.
He Succeeded his Father, May the 26th, 1679.
Mary Antonia, Electr≈øs and Dutche≈øs of Bavaria, daughter to Leopold the Emperour, born Jan. the 18th, 1669.
Married to the Elector, 1686.
They have had but one Child, born May the 21, 1689.
Died the ≈øame year.
The pre≈øent Elector, has but one Brother, and one Si≈øter alive.
I. Clement.
II. Violanta Beatrix, born Jan. the 23, 1673.
Married to the Prince of Tu≈øcany, 1688.
VI. The Elector of Saxony.

div.head: ¬ß I.
div.p: JOhn George III. born June the 20th, 1647.
He Succeeded his Father, Aug. 22th, 1680.
Anne Sophia, Electre≈øs and Dutche≈øs of Saxony, Si≈øter to the pre≈øent King of Denmark, born, 1647.
Married to the Elector, Oct. the 9th, 1666.
Their Children,
1. John George, the Electoral Prince, born Octob. the 17th, 1668.
2. Frederic Augu≈øt, born May the 12th, 1670.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: THe Chief Princes of the ≈øeveral Branches of the Hou≈øe of Saxony.

div.head: (1.) Of the Erne≈øtine Line.
div.p: I. William Erne≈øt, Duke of Wymar, born Octob. the 19th, 1661.
Charlotta Mary, Dutche≈øs of Wymar, daughter to Bernard, Duke of Jena.
Married to the Duke, 1683.
II. John George, Duke of Y≈øenach, born July the 11th, 1634.
Johannetta, Dutche≈øs of Y≈øenach, daughter to Erne≈øt, Count of Seyneu.
Married to the Duke, 1661.
Their Children now alive.
1. Eleonora, born Apr. the 13th, 1662.
Married to John Frederic, Marcgrave of On≈øpach, Nov. the 4th, 1681.
Now Widow.
2. John George, born July the 25th, 1665.
3. John William, born July the 22d 1668.
4. Frederica Elizabeth, born May the 5th, 1669.
III. John William, Duke of Jena, born March the 28th, 1675.
IV. Frederic X. Duke of Gotha, born July the 28th, 1679.
He Succeeded his Father, Aug. the 12th, 1691.
He has four Si≈øters, and one Brother alive.
1. Anne Sophie, born Decem. the 22th, 1670.
2. Dorothe Mary, born Jan. the 22th, 1674.
3. Frederica, born March the 25th, 1675.
4. John William, born Octob. the 4th, 1677.
5. Joan, born Octob. the fir≈øt, 1680.
He has be≈øides ≈øeveral Uncles of his Fathers ≈øide,
I. Albert, Duke of Coburg, Born May the 24, 1648.
II. Duke Bernard, who re≈øides at the Ca≈øtle of Meinungen, in the County of Henneberg, Born Sept. the 15th, 1649.
III. Duke Henry, who re≈øides at Romhild, Born Nov. the 19th, 1650.
IV. Duke Chri≈øtian, who re≈øides at Ei≈øenberg, Born Jan. the 6th, 1653.
V. Duke Erne≈øt, who re≈øides at Eisfeild, Born July the 12th, 1655.

VI. Duke John Erne≈øt, who re≈øides at Salfeld,
Born Augu≈øt the 22th, 1658.

div.head: (2.) Of the Albertine-Line.
div.p: I. John Adolf, Duke of Wei≈ø≈øemfels, born Nov. the 2d. 1649.
He Married Joan Magdalen, daughter to Frederic, Duke of Altenburg, who died, 1686.
His Children alive,
1. Magdalen Sibill, born Sept. the 3d. 1673.
2. John George, born July the 13th, 1677.
3. Joan Withelmine, born Jan. the 20th, 1680.
4. Chri≈øtian, born Feb. the 28th, 1682.
5. Anne Mary, born June the 17th, 1683.
II. Chri≈øtian, Duke of Mersburg, born October the 27th, 1615.
Chri≈øtina, Dutche≈øs of Mersburg, daughter to Philip Duke of Glucksburg.
Married to the Duke, Nov. the 19th, 1650.
Their Children,
1. Chri≈øtian, born Nov. the 19th, 1653.
He has by his Wife, Erdmuth Dorethe his Cou≈øin, three Princes.
(1.) Chri≈øtian, born Nov. the 7th, 1680.
(2.) Mounice William, born Octob. 11th, 1681.
(3.) Augu≈øt Frederic, born March the ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ th, 1684.
2. Augu≈øt, born Feb. the 5th, 1659.
3. Philip, born Octob, the 26th, 1657.
4. Sophia Hedewig, born June the 4th, 1660.
5. Henry, born Sept. the 2d. 1661.
6. Sibill Mary, Born Octob. the 28th, 1667.
They are all Married except Prince Henry.
III. Maurice William, Duke of Naumburg, born March the 12th, 1664.

He Married Mary, daughter to Frederic William,
Elector of Brandenburg, to the Duke of Mecklenburg's Widow, June the 26th, 1689.
He has 2 Brothers, and as many Si≈øters alive.
1. Erdmuth Dorothee, born, 1661.
Married to Duke Chri≈øtian of Mer≈øeburg, 1679.
2. Chri≈øtian Augu≈øt, born Octob. the 9th, 1666.
3. Frederic Henry, born July the 21≈øt, 1668.
4. Withelmine Sibill, born, 1675.
In fine, there are 42 Princes of the Hou≈øe of Saxony alive.

div.head: ¬ß. I.
div.p: VII. THe Elector of Brandenburg,
Frederic III, born July the fir≈øt, 1657.
He Succeeded his Father, Apr. the 29th, 1688.

Sophia Charlotta, Electre≈øs of Brandenburg,
daughter to Erne≈øt Augu≈øt, Duke of Honover, born October the 20th, 1668.
Married to the Elector, Oct. the 6th, 1684.
Their Children,
1. Frederic Augu≈øt, born Oct. the 6th, 1685.
Died, Feb. the 21≈øt. 1686.
2. Frederic William, the Electoral Prince, born Augu≈øt the 4th, 1688.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: The Elector in a former Marriage with Elizabeth Henrica, the pre≈øent Landgrave of He≈øs's Si≈øter, (who died June the 27th, 1683.)
Had one daughter.
Loui≈øa Dorothea Sophia, born Septem, the 19th, 1680.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: THe pre≈øent Elector has four Brothers, and two Si≈øters, alive.
1. Philip William, born in May, 1669.
2. Mary Amalia, born Nov. the 16th, 1670.
Married to Maurice William, Duke of Saxony Naumb.
3. Albert Frederic, born Jan. the 14th, 1672.
4. Charles Philip, born Decem. the 26th, 1672.
5. Elizabeth Sophia, born March the 26th, 1674.
6. Chri≈øtian Lewis, born May the 14th, 1677.

div.head: ¬ß. III.
div.p: THe Chief Princes of the ≈øeveral Branches of the Hou≈øe of Brandenburg.
I. Chri≈øtian Erne≈øt, Markgrave of Bareith, born July the 27th, 1644.

Sophia Loui≈øa Marchione≈øs of Bareith, daughter
to Eberhard the III, Duke of Wirtemberg.
Their Children,
1. Chri≈øtiana Eberhardina, born Decem. the 19th, 1671.
2. Eleonora Magdalen, born Jan. the 14th, 1673.
3. George William, born Nov. the 16th, 1678.
II. Chri≈øtian Henry, Markgrave of Culmback, born July the 19th, 1661.
He has two Brothers, Charles Augu≈øt, born, 1663.
And George Albert, born, 1666.
III. Chri≈øtian Albert, Markgrave of On≈øpach., Born Sept. the 8th, 1675.
He has two Brothers, and as many Si≈øters alive.
1. Dorothea Frederica, Born Aug. the 12th, 1676.
2. George Frederic, born Apr. the 25th, 1678.
3. Withelmina Charlotta, Born March the fir≈øt, 1683.
4. William Frederic, Born Dec. the 29th, 1685.
There are 14 Princes of the Hou≈øe of Brandenburg alive.

div.head: ¬ß. I.
div.p: VIII. THe Elector Palatin,
John William, Elector Palatin, and Duke of Newburg, Born Apr. the 19th, 1658.
He Succeeded his Father, 1690.
The Electre≈øs and Counte≈øs Palatin, daughter to Co≈ømus the III, Great Duke of Tu ‚Ä¢ s;cany, was Married to the Elector, 1691.

div.head: Remark,
div.p:
The pre≈øent Elector, had by his former Wife Mary Anne, Si≈øter to the pre≈øent Emperour, (who died 1689.) but one
Child that came dead to the World, 1683.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: THe pre≈øent Elector, has 6 Si≈øters, and as many Brothers alive.
His Si≈øters are,
1. Eleonora, Empre≈øs of Germany, Born Jan. the 6th, 1655.
2. Mary Sophia, Queen of Portugal, Born Augu≈øt the 6th, 1666.
3. Mary Anne, Queen of Spain, Born Octob. the 28th, 1667.
4. Dorothea Sophia Prince≈øs of Poland, Born July the 12th, 1670.
5. Hedewig Elizabeth, Born July the 18th, 1673.
6. Leopoldine Eleonore, born May the 27th, 1679.
His Brothers are,
1. Lewis, Great Ma≈øter of the Teutonick Order, Born July the 9th, 1660.
2. Charles, born Nov. the 4th, 1661.
He Married Loui≈øa Charlotta, Prince≈øs of Radzevil, July the 24th, 1688.
3. Alexander, Bi≈øhop of Augsburg, born April the 16th, 1663.
4. Francis, Bi≈øhop of Bre≈ølau, born July the 24th, 1683.
5. Frederic, born July the 20th, 1665.
6. Philip, born Nov. the 18th, 1668.

div.head: ¬ß. III.
div.p: THe Branch of Sultzbach, of the Hou≈øe Palatin.
Chri≈øtian Augu≈øt, Count Palatin of Sultzback, born July the 16th, 1622.
He has by his Wife Amalia of Na≈ø≈øau, but one Prince alive, who is Theodore, born Febr. the 14th, 1659.
Philip, his Brother, born Jan 19th, 1630.

div.head: The Hou≈øe of Brun≈øwig, and Lunenburg.
1. The Hou≈øe of Wolfembuttel.
div.p: I. Rudolf Augu≈øt, Duke of Wolfembuttel, born May the 16th, 1628.
He had by his Wife Chri≈øtina Elizabeth, three daughters, of which 2 are alive.
1. Dorothea Sophia, born Jan. he 18th, 1653.
Married to John Adolf, Duke of Ploen, 1673.
2. Chri≈øtina Sophia, born Apr. the 3d. 1654.
Married to her Cou≈øin Duke Augu≈øt William, 1681.
II. Anthony Ulric, who Governs the Country, together with his Brother Rudolf Augu≈øt, born Octob. the 4th, 1633.
Elizabeth Juliana, Dutche≈øs of Wolfembuttel, Born May the 24th, 1634.
Married to the Duke, Aug. the 17th, 1656.
Their Children now alive.
1. Elizabeth Eleonora, Born 1658.
Married to Bernard, Duke of Saxony.
2. Anne Sophia, Born Octob. the 28th, 1659.
Married to Charles Gu≈øtave, Markgrave of Baden. 1677.
3. Augu≈øt William, born March the 8th, 1662.
He Married his Cou≈øin Prince≈øs, Chri≈øtina Sophia.
4. Augu≈øta Dorothea, Born Dec. the 16th, 1666.
Married to Anthony Gunther, Count of Swartzburg, 1684.
5. Henrietta Chri≈øtina, Born September the 19th, 1669.
6. Lewis Rudolf, born July the 22th, 1671.
III. Augu≈øt Ferdinand Duke of Bevern, Born 1677.
He has three Brothers and one Si≈øter alive.

div.head: 2. The Hou≈øe of Brun≈øwig, Lunenburg-Zell.
div.p: I. George VVilliam, Duke of Zelle, Born Febr. the 16th, 1624.
Eleonora De≈øiniers, Dutche≈øs of Zell, formerly call'd Madam d' Harbourg.
They have but one daughter Sophia Dorothea, Born Septemb. the 15th, 1666.
Married to George Lewis, Prince of Hanover, her Cou≈øin, Nov. the 21≈øt. 1682.

div.head: 3. The Hou≈øe of Brun≈øwig, Lunenburg-Hanover.
div.p: II. Erne≈øt Augu≈øt, Duke of Hanover, born Nov. the 10th, 1629.
Sophia, Dutche≈øs of Hanover, daughter to the King of Bohemia, born Octob. the 13th, 1630
Married to the Duke 1658.
Their Children.
1. George Lewis, born May the 28th, 1660.
He Married the Prince≈øs of Zell, Nov. the 21≈øt. 1682.
2. Frederic Augu≈øt, born Octob. the 3d. 1661.
Died in Hungary, 1689.
3. Maximilian, born Decem. the 14th, 1666.
Died in Morea.
4. Sophia Charlotta, born Octob. the 20th, 1668.
Married to the pre≈øent Elector of Brandenburg, Octob. the 6th, 1684.
5. Charles, born Octob. the 23d. 1669.
Died in Hungary, 1690.
6. Chri≈øtian, born Sept. the 29th, 1671.
7. Erne≈øt Augu≈øt, born Sept. the 17th, 1674.

div.head: (1.) He≈øs-Ca≈ø≈øel.
div.p: I. Charles, Landgrave of He≈øs-Ca≈ø≈øel, born Aug. the 3d. 1654.
Mary Amalia, Prince≈øs of He≈øs-Ca≈ø≈øel, Si≈øter to Frederic Ca≈øimir, the pre≈øent Duke of Curland, born May the 21≈øt. 1673.
Married to the Landgrave, May the 21≈øt. 1673.
Their Children,
1. William, born March the 29th, 1674
Since Dead.
2. Charles, born, 1675.
Died Decem. the 7th, 1677.
3. Frederic, the hereditary Prince, born Apr. the 28th, 1676.
4. Chri≈øtian, born 1677
Since Dead.
5. Sophia Charlotta, born July the 16th, 1678.
6. Charles, born June the 12th, 1680.
7. William, born 1682.
Died the ≈øame year.
8. Leopold, born Nov. the 30th, 1684.
II. Philip, Prince of Hir≈øchfeld, born Dec. the 14th, 1654.
He has with Amalia Catherina, of Solms, two Children.
1. Withelmina Hedewig, born Octob. the 9th, 1681.
2. Charles, born Sept. the 23d, 1682.

div.head: 2. He≈øs-Darm≈øtad.
div.p: Erne≈øt Lewis, Landgrave of He≈øs-Darm≈øtad, born Dec. the 15th, 1667.
He Married Charlotte, Prince≈øs of On≈øpach, 1678.
His Brothers and Si≈øtets alive are,
1. Magdalen, Dowager of Wirtemberg, born Apr. the 28th, 1652.
2. George, Brigadier General of the Army in Ireland, born April the 25th, 1669.
3. Sophia Loui≈øa, born July the 6th, 1670.
4. Philip, born July the 21≈øt, 1671.
5. Henry, born Sept. the 29th, 1674.
6. Elizabeth Dorothee, Born Apr. the 2d, 1676.
7. Frederic, born Sept. the 18th, 1677.

div.head: (3.) The Branch of Homburg.
div.p: Frederic, Landgrave of Homburg, born, 1673.
He has two Brothers, Charles Chri≈øtian, born 1674.
Philip, Born, 1676.

div.head: The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Mecklenburg.
(1.) Mecklenburg-Swerin.
div.p: Chri≈øtian Lewis, Duke of Mecklenburg-Swerin, born December the fir≈øt, 1623.
He's turn'd Papi≈øt, and lives in France, where he Married I≈øabella Angelica, of Mommotanci, the Duke de Chatillons Widow, he has no Children.

div.head: (2.) Mecklenburg-Gu≈øtrow.
div.p: Gu≈øtave Adolf, Duke of Mecklanburg-Gu≈øtrow, Born February the 26th, 1633.
Magdalen Sibill, Dutche≈øs of Gu≈øtrow, born, 1631.
Married to the Duke Nov. the 28th, 1654.
Their Children alive,
1. Mary, Born, 1659.
Married to her Cou≈øin Adolf.
2. Magdalen, born July the 4th, 1660.
3. Sophia, Born June the 21≈øt, 1662.
4. Chri≈øtina, born Aug. the 14th, 1663.
Married to Chri≈øtian Lewis, Count of Stolberg.
5. Hedewig Eleonora, born Jan. the 12th, 1666.
6. Loui≈øa, born Aug. the 28th, 1667.
7. Elizabeth, born Sept. the 13th, 1668.
8. Augu≈øta, born Dec. the 3d, 1674.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: Altho' there is no Male-Heir of the Hou≈øe of Gu≈øtrow, and that Chri≈øtian Lewis, the Duke Regent of Swerin, has no Children at all, yet the Latter, has a Brother, and Brothers Children alive, viz.
I. His Brothers, Frederic's, Duke of Grabow's Sons:
1. Frederic William, Duke of Grabow, born March the 13th, 1675.
2. Charles, born, 1679.
II. Adolf Augu≈øt, his Brother, re≈øiding at the Ca≈øtle of Strelite, born 1658.
He has with his Wife Mary, daughter to Gu≈øtav. Adolf, Duke of Mecklenburg, one Son, Gu≈øtave Adolf.

div.head: The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Wirtemberg.
(1.) Stutgard.
div.p: Eberhard Lewis, Duke of Wirtemberg, born Sep. the 18th, 1676.
He lives ≈øtill under the Tutor≈øhip of his Mother and Uncle.
His Mother,

Magdalen Sibill, Dutche≈øs Dowager of Wirtemberg, daughter to Lewis VII. Landgrave
of He≈øs-Darm≈øted, born Apr. the 28th, 1652.
His Uncle is,
Frederic Charles, Duke Admini≈øtrator of Wirtemberg, Born Sept. the 12th, 1652.
He Married Eleonore, daughter to Albert, Markgrave of On≈øpach, 1682.
And has by her 3 Children,
1. Charles Alexander, Born January the 24th, 1684.
2. Dorothea Charlot, Born September the fir≈øt, 1685.
3. Frederic Charles, Born Octob. the 28th, 1686
The Duke Admini≈øtrator has three Brothers, and four Si≈øters alive, viz.
1. Sophia Loui≈øa, Born Febr. the 18th, 1642.

Married to Chri≈øtian
Erne≈øt, Markgrave of Bareith, 1671.
2. Chri≈øtin Charlotte, Born October the 21≈øt, 1645.
Married to the late Prince of Ea≈øt-Frie≈øland, 1662.
3. Anne Catherin, born Nov. the 27th, 1648,
4. Charles Maximilian, Born Sept. the 28th, 1654.
5. Lewis, Born Augu≈øt the 13th, 1661.
6. John Frederic, born June the 10th, 1669.
7. Sophie Charlotte, Born February the 22th, 1671.
The three latter are the Admini≈øtrators Brothers and Si≈øter, but by the Father.

div.head: (2.) New≈øtad.
div.p:
Frederic Augu≈øt, Duke of Wirtemberg-New≈øtad,
Born March the 12th, 1654.
He has two Brothers alive,
1. Ferdinand William, General of the Dani≈øh Forces in Ireland, born Sept. the 12th 1659.
2. Charles Rudolf, born 1667.

div.head: (3.) Mompelgard,
div.p:
George II. Duke of
Wirtemberg Mompelgard, born October the 5th, 1626.
He was depriv'd of his Country by the French King, 1684.
There is another Branch of the Hou≈øe of Wirtemberg, that is now in P ‚Ä¢ ≈ø≈øe≈ø≈øion of the Principality of Oels, in Sile≈øia, of which there is now alive,
1. Sylvius Frederic, born February the 21≈øt, 1651.
2. Chri≈øtian Ulric, born Apr. the 9th, 1652.

div.head: The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Baden.
(1.) Baden-Baden, Roman Catholicks.
div.p:
Lewis William, Markgrave of Baden, General of all the Emperor's
Forces in Hungary, born Apr. the 8th, 1655.
The French King has deprived him of the greate≈øt part of his Country.
He Married Anne Mary, the late Duke of Saxe Lawenburg's daughter, 1691.
He has one Uncle,

Herman the Emperours principal Commi≈ø≈øary
at the Dyet at Ratisbonne, born Octob. the 11th, 1628

div.head: (2.) Baden-Durlach, Prote≈øtants.
div.p: Frederic, Markgrave of Baden-Durlach, born Sept. the 27th, 1647.
He Married Augu≈øta Mary, daughter to Frederic Duke of Gottorp, May the 15th, 1670.
1. Catherine, born Oct. the 10th, 1676.
2. Charles William, born Jan. 17th, 1679.
3. Joan Elizabeth, born Octob. the 3d. 1680.
4. Albertine Frederica, born July the 3d. 1682.
5. Chri≈øto≈øle, born Sept. the 28th, 1684.
6. Charlotte Sophie, born March the fir≈øt, 1686.
Charles Gu≈øtave, born Sept. the 27th, 1648.

div.head: Remark,
div.p: Prince Frederic, of Durlach, has two natural Sons, Frederic and Bernard Barons of Muntzenheim.

div.head: The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Saxe Lawenburg, and Anhalt.
Saxe Lawenburg, Roman Catholick.
div.p: The la≈øt Prince of this Family was, Julius Francis, who left two daughters behind him, viz.
1. Anne Mary, Born June the 13th, 1672.
Married to Prince Lewis of Baden, 1691.
2. Franci≈øca, Born June the 21≈øt. 1675.

div.head: (1.) Anhalt-De≈ø≈øau.
div.p: John George, Prince of Anhalt-De≈ø≈øau, Born Nov. the 7th, 1627.
Henrica Catherine, Prince≈øs of Anhalt, daughter to Henry Frederic, Prince of Orange, Born, 1637.
Married to the Prince, 1658.
1. Elizabeth Albertine Abbe≈ø≈øe, of Erfurd, born 1665.
2. Amalia, born, 1666.

Married to Prince Henry Ca≈øimir, Stadholder
of Frie≈øland and Groningen, 1684.
3. Mary Eleonore, Prince≈øs Dowager of Radzivil, born, 1671.
4. Henrica Agnes, born January the 9th, 1674.
Married to Henry, Duke of Saxony, 1689.
5. Leopold, the hereditary Prince, born July the 3d. 1676.
6. Joan Charlotte, born Apr. the 6th, 1682.

div.head: (2.) Anhalt-Bernburg.
div.p: Victor Amadee, Prince Anhalt-Bernburg, born Octob. the 6th, 1634.
He Married Elizabeth, daughter to Frederic, Prince Palatin of Deux-Ponts, Apr. the 17th, 1677.
1. Charles Frederic, born July the 13th, 1668.
2. Lebrecht, born June the 28th, 1669.
3. John George, born Febr. the 14th, 1674.

div.head: (3.) Anhalt Hatzgeroda.
div.p: William II. born Aug. the 18th, 1643.
Married to Elizabeth, of Solms, 1671.

div.head: (4.) Anhalt-Ploetzknow.
div.p: Immanuel, Prince of Anhalt-Ploetzknow.
He is the la≈øt Prince of this Branch.

div.head: (5.) Anhalt-Zerb≈øt.
div.p: Charles William, Prince of Anhalt-Zerb≈øt, born Octob, the 26th, 1652.

He Married Sophia Augu≈øta, daughter to
the Duke Admini≈øtrator of Magdeburg, June the 18th, 1676.
Their Children.
1. John Augu≈øt, born July the 20th, 1677.
2. Charles Frederic, born July the 8th, 1678.
3. Magdalen Augu≈øta, born October the 20th, 1679.
He has be≈øides three Brothers alive, viz.
1. Antony Gunther, born November the 11th, 1653.
2. John Adolf, born Decem. the 2d. 1654.
3. John Lewis, born May the 4th, 1656.

div.head: The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Na≈ø≈øau.

The Chief of this Family
is William, the III. King of Great Britain:
(1.) Na≈ø≈øau Siegen.
div.p: William Maurice, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau, Prote≈øtant, born Jan. the 6th, 1678.
He Married Erne≈øtine Charlotte, daughter to Adolf, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau-Dillenburg, by whom he has but one Prince, born Febr. the 20th, 1688.

John Francis, Roman
Catholick, Knight of the Golden-Fleece, Governour of the Spani≈øh Gelderland.
I. With Joan Claudia, Counte≈øs of Konig≈øeck, who died, 1664.
II. With Mary, daughter to Prince Herman of Baden, who died, 1668.
1. Erne≈øtina Eleonora.
2. Clara Chiliana.
3. Albertina Gabrielis.

div.head: (2.) Na≈ø≈øau Dillenburg.
div.p: Henry, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau-Dillenburg, born Aug. the 28th, 1641.

He Married Dorothea, daughter to George Duke
of Lignitz, and has ≈øix Children alive, viz.
1. Sophia Augu≈øta, born Apr. the 18th, 1666.
2. George Lewis, born June the 21≈øt. 1667.
3. Albertina, born Aug. the 8th, 1668.
4. William, born Aug. the 28th, 1670.
5. Adolf, born March the 7th, 1673.
6. Frederica Amalia, born in Decem. 1674.

div.head: (3.) Na≈ø≈øau-Dietz.
div.p: Henry Ca≈øimir, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau-Dietz, Stadholder of Frie≈øland and Groninge, born in Jan. 1657.
He Married Henrica Amalia, daughter to John George II. Prince of Anhalt, 1684.

div.head: (4.) Na≈ø≈øau. Hadamar.
div.p: Francis Alexander, Prince of Na≈ø≈øau-Hadamar, born Jan. the 27th, 1674.
He lives under the Tutor≈øhip of his Uncle, and his Mother in Law.

div.head: (5.) Na≈ø≈øau.
div.p: The Prince of Na≈ø≈øau-Sarbruck, made a Prince by a Patent, from the Emperour, 1690.

div.head: The Princes of the Hou≈øe of Lorrain.
div.p: Charles Leopold, the late Duke of Lorrain; who Married Eleonora, Queen Dowager of Poland, has left the≈øe following Children behind him.
1. Leopold Jo≈øeph, born Sept. the 11th, 1679.
2. Jo≈øeph John, Born Nov. the 24th, 1680.
3. Anonymus, born Apr. the 28th, 1682.
4. Ferdinand Jo≈øeph, born Augu≈øt the 17th, 1683.
5. Jo≈øeph Innocent, born October the 20th, 1685.
6. Francis Antony, born Dec. the 8th, 1689.

div.head: The Princes of Italy.
div.p: Pope Innocent XII. born at Naples in March, 1615
Cho≈øen Pope, July the 11th, 1691.
He is Son to the Prince of Minerbino, of the Family of Pignato, the Chief whereof is the Duke of Terra Nova, Grandee of Spain.

div.head: The Hou≈øe of Tu≈øcany.
div.p: Co≈ømus III. Great Duke of Tu≈øcany, born, 1642.
He Succeeded his Father, 1670.
Margaretha Loui≈øa, Great Dutche≈øs of Tu≈øcany, daughter to Ga≈øton, Duke of Orleans.
They have got but one Prince Ga≈øton, Married to Violanta Beatrix, Si≈øter to the pre≈øent Elector of Bavaria, 1688.
And one Prince Married to the pre≈øent Elector Palatin, 1691.

div.head: ¬ß I.
div.p: VIctor Amadee II. Duke of Savoy, and King of Cyprus, born May the 17th, 1666.
He Succeeded his Father, June the 12th, 1675.
Anne Mary, Dutche≈øs of Savoy, daughter to Philip, Duke of Orleans,
Married to the Duke, Apr. the 9th, 1684.
Their Children,
1. Mary Adelherd, born Decem. the 6th, 1685.
2. Another Prince≈øs, born Augu≈øt the 30th, 1688.

div.head: ¬ß. II.
div.p: THe Princes of the Blood of Savoy.
(I.) Emanuel Philibert, Prince of Carignan, born Aug. the 20th, 1628.
And though he was Born Dumb, yet he Married Mary Catherine, d' E≈øte, 1684.
(II.) Lewis Thomas, Count of Soi≈ø≈øons, Nephew to the Prince of Carignan, born December the 15th, 1657.
He Married Urania, de la Cropte, a French Gentle woman, December the 17th, 1682.
He has two Brothers, and two Si≈øters alive, viz.
1. Philippe, born, 1659.
2. Prince Eugene of Savoy, born, 1665,
3. Mary, Born January the fir≈øt, 1665.
4. Aloi≈øa, Born Nov. the 22d, 1667.

div.head: IV. The Hou≈øe of Mantua.
div.p:
Charles III, Duke of Mantua, he Married I≈øabella
Clara, Arch Duke Leopolds Daughter.
He Succeeded his Father, 1637.

div.head: V. The Hou≈øe of Parma, and Placentia.
div.p:
Rainutius II, Duke of Parma, and Placentia: He Married 1. Margaretha Jolanda, the Duke
of Savoys Si≈øter, and after her Death, 2. I≈øabella d' E≈øte, daughter to Francis, Duke of Modena, ≈øince Dead.
He has got but one Prince Odoard III.

div.head: The Hou≈øe of Modena.
div.p: Franci≈øco, Duke of Modena, born, 1656.
He Married one of the Family of the Barbarins.
He has one Uncle, and one Si≈øter alive, viz.
1. Almericus, Cardinal d' E≈øte.
2. Mary, born Sept. the 25th, 1658.
Married to the late King James, 1673.

div.head: The Hou≈øe of Curland.
div.p: Frederic Ca≈øimir, Duke of Curland.
I. He Married Sophia Amalia, Prince≈øs of Na≈ø≈øan-Siegen, who Died December the 25th, 1688.
II. Elizabeth Sophia, Si≈øter to the pre≈øent Elector of Brandenburg, 1691.
He has one Brother, and three Si≈øters alive, viz.
I. Ferdinand, Lieutenant General of the Elector of Brandenburg's Forces.
II. Loui≈øa Elizabeth, Married to Frederic, Landgrave of Homburg, 1671.
III. Mary Amalia, Married to the pre≈øent Landgrave of He≈øs, May th 21≈øt, 1673.

div.head: Books Printed, and are to be Sold by Abel Roper, at the Mitre in Fleet≈øtreet.
div.p: 1. ADvice to a Daughter under the≈øe following Heads, viz. Religion, &c.

2. A Weeks Exerci≈øe preparatory towards a worthy Reception of the Lords Supper, in Meditations, Prayers and Ejaculations, before,
